intro: Eriospora setifera, commonly known as the hairy spore plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and hairy stems, which give it its common name. The plant is native to South America and thrives in moist, temperate environments. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Eriospora setifera is often found in meadows and along stream banks, where it plays a role in local ecosystems.
